name: Engineering Terms
description: Common engineering and technical terminology used in software development

definitions.definition: Application Programming Interface - A set of protocols and tools for building software applications
A contract between different software components that defines how they can communicate
Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment - Automated processes for integrating code changes and deploying to production
Representational State Transfer - An architectural style for designing networked applications
A query language for APIs and a runtime for executing those queries with your existing data
An architectural style that structures an application as a collection of small, independent services
A platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers
An open-source container orchestration platform for automating deployment, scaling, and management
Test-Driven Development - A software development approach where tests are written before the code
Pull Request - A method of submitting contributions to a project
Peer Review - The process of reviewing code changes before merging
Software as a Service - A software delivery model where applications are hosted and provided over the internet
Open Authorization - An open standard for access delegation, commonly used for token-based authentication
JSON Web Token - A compact, URL-safe means of representing claims to be transferred between two parties
Cross-Origin Resource Sharing - A mechanism that allows restricted resources on a web page to be requested from another domain
Secure Sockets Layer/Transport Layer Security - Cryptographic protocols for secure communication over networks
Create, Read, Update, Delete - The four basic operations of persistent storage
Object-Relational Mapping - A technique for converting data between incompatible type systems in OOP languages
Structured Query Language - A domain-specific language for managing relational databases
Not Only SQL - Database systems that store and retrieve data without using tabular relations
A distributed version control system for tracking changes in source code
An iterative approach to software development emphasizing flexibility and collaboration
